content:
So I have been working on redesigning the buttons in the settings page and also adding some font-awesome icons to it. I'm tending towards a more materialistic approach and I would like to have some feedback on the design so far.

Blue and Red Green and Disabled
Yeah material design looks good, is it possible to also update the textbox so it is consistent?
Thanks, am working on that. And is it okay if I modify the existing classes or should I create new classes for new designs?

How about this design for the textbox, @Tommy Ip?
Textbox v1 Textbox v1 focussed

IMO I am not too big of a fan of the textbox styling, it feels too similar to the buttons. I prefer the stock material textbox https://assets.materialup.com/uploads/4cc55618-c484-4cd1-a3a4-c1dafd0cfc73/material_design_input.gif
Though I guess we don't want to copy them directly
I get it, I share the same view! But I thought you wanted the textbox to be consistent with the buttons. Anyways, now I will work on this material textfield.
The above design reminds me of the Russian flag. :) I like a more green color for submit buttons, since Zulip has a green-ish theme generally, and also green means "go" to me.

That didn't strike me! I will definitely make the submit buttons green. :)
Also, is the green am currently using okay? Or you would like the zulip green better, @Steve Howell?
I think we should use the zulip green, but @Brock Whittaker is probably the person to ask here.

The Zulip green seems good to me.
Zulip Green Button

I think that we should stray away from material design and box shadows as it wasn't ever a part of the Zulip style guide and is less-so now with newer implemented designs such as the subscriptions page and the compose box. I do think adding icons to some buttons is a good idea to show their importance.

Oh sorry, I got it now. So, I will change the style similar to the newly implemented ones? Or is a different design required?
And yes, I have added icons to most of the buttons.
I like the design of the buttons in the development login page screenshot you uploaded, @Brock Whittaker . Would those buttons look good in the settings?

When in doubt, stick with the style that has already been implemented. Everything will look its best when everything finally has the same styling!
We were planning on using those buttons (in the dev login page) for portico pages (login, register, etc). We should probably stick with something stylistically similar to the compose buttons or subscriptions page buttons for logged in stuff.
Okay I will stick with that. I will do those designs and show you now, if you are okay with it I will go ahead. :)

How about these, @Brock Whittaker ?
I have made the buttons similar to the ones in subscription page. I think that the transparent background suits the settings page.
New buttons
@Brock Whittaker , I have created a Pull Request with a redesigned buttons. Please, take a look. :)
where do I find the dev login?
@Matthias MÃ¼ller "dev login" is the login page in the Zulip development environment; it doesn't exist in production since it's purpose is to be fast to support testing (it's totally insecure)
Ok I See. Thanks
